page.title: 09MRS. PRICE REMEMBERS.
page.content: When I was a little girl my name was Gwenllian Jenkins. I was one of eleven children. I had ten brothers. I was born in Trebanos but at nine months old I came to live in Saron Chapel cottage and I have lived there ever since - 73 years. Rhyd y fro was very different then. I can remember only two people who owned cars, the minister and the blacksmith. I started school at the age of five but as I lived opposite the school I often sneaked home to help my mother. I liked school and was especially good at reading but also enjoyed essays, writing in my diary, arithmetic and sewing. Our teachers were kind but very strict and naughty children always got the cane. At playtime we played with hoops, whips and tops but my favourite game was cricket.
